content.description: The table depicts the number of good behaviors that are reinforced for students in elementary classrooms. Group 1 is offered pizza or ice cream they can eat immediately when they demonstrate good behavior. Group 2 is offered a “good behavior ticket” for each good behavior that they can use to “purchase” pizza or ice cream at the end of the week.
content.question: Classroom Group 1 Group 2 Classroom #1 14 8 Classroom #2 13 4 Classroom #3 15 9 Classroom #4 13 10 Classroom #5 14 5 Which type of reinforcement has a larger range according to the data depicted in the table?

skill.text: 3.B: Calculate and interpret measures of central tendency, variation, and percentile rank in a given data set.
